dataContractSpecification.title: DataContractSpecificationVersion
dataContractSpecification.description: Specifies the Data Contract Specification being used.

id.description: Specifies the identifier of the data contract.

title.description: The title of the data contract.

version.description: The version of the data contract document (which is distinct from the Data Contract Specification version or the Data Product implementation version).

status.description: The status of the data contract. Can be proposed, in development, active, retired.

description.description: A description of the data contract.

owner.description: The owner or team responsible for managing the data contract and providing the data.

name.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization.

url.description: The URL pointing to the contact information. This MUST be in the form of a URL.

email.description: The email address of the contact person/organization. This MUST be in the form of an email address.

contact.description: Contact information for the data contract.

info.description: Metadata and life cycle information about the data contract.

description.description: An optional string describing the servers.

environment.description: The environment in which the servers are running. Examples: prod, sit, stg.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

project.description: An optional string describing the server.

dataset.description: An optional string describing the server.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

location.description: An optional string describing the server. Must be in the form of a URL.

endpointUrl.description: The server endpoint for S3-compatible servers.

delimiter.description: Only for format = json. How multiple json documents are delimited within one file

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

location.description: The GS/GCS url to the data.

delimiter.description: Only for format = json. How multiple json documents are delimited within one file

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

location.description: An optional string describing the server. Must be in the form of a sftp URL.

delimiter.description: Only for format = json. How multiple json documents are delimited within one file

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

account.description: An optional string describing the server.

host.description: An optional string describing the host name.

database.description: An optional string describing the server.

schema.description: An optional string describing the server.

clusterIdentifier.description: An optional string describing the cluster's identifier.

port.description: An optional string describing the cluster's port.

endpoint.description: An optional string describing the cluster's endpoint.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

location.description: Fully qualified path to Azure Blob Storage or Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS), supports globs.

delimiter.description: Only for format = json. How multiple json documents are delimited within one file

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

host.description: The host to the database server

port.description: The port to the database server.

schema.description: The name of the schema in the database.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

account.description: An optional string describing the server.

database.description: An optional string describing the server.

schema.description: An optional string describing the server.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

catalog.description: The name of the Hive or Unity catalog

schema.description: The schema name in the catalog

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.
The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

location.description: The AWS S3 path. Must be in the form of a URL.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

host.description: The host to the database server

port.description: The port to the database server.

schema.description: The name of the schema in the database.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

host.description: The host to the oracle server

port.description: The port to the oracle server.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

host.description: The bootstrap server of the kafka cluster.

format.description: The format of the message. Examples: json, avro, protobuf. Default: json.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.
The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

stream.description: The name of the Kinesis data stream.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

host.description: The host to the database server

port.description: The port to the database server.

schema.description: The name of the schema in the database.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

path.description: The relative or absolute path to the data file(s).

terms.description: The terms and conditions of the data contract.

usage.description: The usage describes the way the data is expected to be used. Can contain business and technical information.

limitations.description: The limitations describe the restrictions on how the data can be used, can be technical or restrictions on what the data may not be used for.

billing.description: The billing describes the pricing model for using the data, such as whether it's free, having a monthly fee, or metered pay-per-use.

noticePeriod.description: The period of time that must be given by either party to terminate or modify a data usage agreement. Uses ISO-8601 period format, e.g., 'P3M' for a period of three months.

models.description: Specifies the logical data model. Use the models name (e.g., the table name) as the key.

type.description: The type of the model. Examples: table, view, object. Default: table.
type.title: ModelType

title.description: An optional string providing a human readable name for the model. Especially useful if the model name is cryptic or contains abbreviations.

fields.description: Specifies a field in the data model. Use the field name (e.g., the column name) as the key.

description.description: An optional string describing the semantic of the data in this field.

title.description: An optional string providing a human readable name for the field. Especially useful if the field name is cryptic or contains abbreviations.

required.description: An indication, if this field must contain a value and may not be null.

fields.description: The nested fields (e.g. columns) of the object, record, or struct.

primary.description: If this field is a primary key.

references.description: The reference to a field in another model. E.g. use 'orders.order_id' to reference the order_id field of the model orders. Think of defining a foreign key relationship.

unique.description: An indication, if the value must be unique within the model.

enum.description: A value must be equal to one of the elements in this array value. Only evaluated if the value is not null.

minLength.description: A value must greater than, or equal to, the value of this. Only applies to string types.

maxLength.description: A value must less than, or equal to, the value of this. Only applies to string types.

format.description: A specific format the value must comply with (e.g., 'email', 'uri', 'uuid').

precision.description: The maximum number of digits in a number. Only applies to numeric values. Defaults to 38.

scale.description: The maximum number of decimal places in a number. Only applies to numeric values. Defaults to 0.

pattern.description: A regular expression the value must match. Only applies to string types.

minimum.description: A value of a number must greater than, or equal to, the value of this. Only evaluated if the value is not null. Only applies to numeric values.

exclusiveMinimum.description: A value of a number must greater than the value of this. Only evaluated if the value is not null. Only applies to numeric values.

maximum.description: A value of a number must less than, or equal to, the value of this. Only evaluated if the value is not null. Only applies to numeric values.

exclusiveMaximum.description: A value of a number must less than the value of this. Only evaluated if the value is not null. Only applies to numeric values.

example.description: An example value for this field.

pii.description: An indication, if this field contains Personal Identifiable Information (PII).

classification.description: The data class defining the sensitivity level for this field, according to the organization's classification scheme.

tags.description: Custom metadata to provide additional context.

additionalProperties.title: Link
additionalProperties.description: A URL to an external resource.

$ref.description: A reference URI to a definition in the specification, internally or externally. Properties will be inherited from the definition.

avroType.description: Specify the field type to use when exporting the data model to Apache Avro.

avroLogicalType.description: Specify the logical field type to use when exporting the data model to Apache Avro.

bigqueryType.description: Specify the physical column type that is used in a BigQuery table, e.g., `NUMERIC(5, 2)`.

snowflakeType.description: Specify the physical column type that is used in a Snowflake table, e.g., `TIMESTAMP_LTZ`.

redshiftType.description: Specify the physical column type that is used in a Redshift table, e.g., `SMALLINT`.

sqlserverType.description: Specify the physical column type that is used in a SQL Server table, e.g., `DATETIME2`.

databricksType.description: Specify the physical column type that is used in a Databricks Unity Catalog table.

glueType.description: Specify the physical column type that is used in an AWS Glue Data Catalog table.

avroNamespace.description: The namespace to use when importing and exporting the data model from / to Apache Avro.

definitions.description: Clear and concise explanations of syntax, semantic, and classification of business objects in a given domain.

domain.description: The domain in which this definition is valid.

name.description: The technical name of this definition.

title.description: The business name of this definition.

description.description: Clear and concise explanations related to the domain.

fields.description: The nested fields (e.g. columns) of the object, record, or struct.

minLength.description: A value must be greater than or equal to this value. Applies only to string types.

maxLength.description: A value must be less than or equal to this value. Applies only to string types.

format.description: Specific format requirements for the value (e.g., 'email', 'uri', 'uuid').

precision.description: The maximum number of digits in a number. Only applies to numeric values. Defaults to 38.

scale.description: The maximum number of decimal places in a number. Only applies to numeric values. Defaults to 0.

pattern.description: A regular expression pattern the value must match. Applies only to string types.

minimum.description: A value of a number must greater than, or equal to, the value of this. Only evaluated if the value is not null. Only applies to numeric values.

exclusiveMinimum.description: A value of a number must greater than the value of this. Only evaluated if the value is not null. Only applies to numeric values.

maximum.description: A value of a number must less than, or equal to, the value of this. Only evaluated if the value is not null. Only applies to numeric values.

exclusiveMaximum.description: A value of a number must less than the value of this. Only evaluated if the value is not null. Only applies to numeric values.

pii.description: Indicates if the field contains Personal Identifiable Information (PII).

classification.description: The data class defining the sensitivity level for this field.

tags.description: Custom metadata to provide additional context.

additionalProperties.title: Link
additionalProperties.description: A URL to an external resource.

type.title: SchemaType
type.description: The type of the schema. Typical values are dbt, bigquery, json-schema, sql-ddl, avro, protobuf, custom.

oneOf.description: The specification of the schema as a string.
The specification of the schema as an object.

schema.description: The schema of the data contract describes the syntax and semantics of provided data sets. It supports different schema types.

type.title: ExampleType
type.description: The type of the example data. Well-known types are csv, json, yaml, custom.

description.description: An optional string describing the example.

model.description: The reference to the model in the schema, e.g., a table name.

oneOf.description: Example data for this model in a structured format. Use this for type json or yaml.

examples.description: The Examples Object is an array of Example Objects.

servicelevels.description: Specifies the service level agreements for the provided data, including availability, data retention policies, latency requirements, data freshness, update frequency, support availability, and backup policies.

availability.description: Availability refers to the promise or guarantee by the service provider about the uptime of the system that provides the data.

description.description: An optional string describing the availability service level.
description.example: The server is available during support hours

percentage.description: An optional string describing the guaranteed uptime in percent (e.g., `99.9%`)

retention.description: Retention covers the period how long data will be available.

description.description: An optional string describing the retention service level.
description.example: Data is retained for one year.

period.description: An optional period of time, how long data is available. Supported formats: Simple duration (e.g., `1 year`, `30d`) and ISO 8601 duration (e.g, `P1Y`).

unlimited.description: An optional indicator that data is kept forever.

timestampField.description: An optional reference to the field that contains the timestamp that the period refers to.

latency.description: Latency refers to the maximum amount of time from the source to its destination.

description.description: An optional string describing the latency service level.
description.example: Data is available within 25 hours after the order was placed.

threshold.description: An optional maximum duration between the source timestamp and the processed timestamp. Supported formats: Simple duration (e.g., `24 hours`, `5s`) and ISO 8601 duration (e.g, `PT24H`).

sourceTimestampField.description: An optional reference to the field that contains the timestamp when the data was provided at the source.

processedTimestampField.description: An optional reference to the field that contains the processing timestamp, which denotes when the data is made available to consumers of this data contract.

freshness.description: The maximum age of the youngest row in a table.

description.description: An optional string describing the freshness service level.
description.example: The age of the youngest row in a table is within 25 hours.

threshold.description: An optional maximum age of the youngest entry. Supported formats: Simple duration (e.g., `24 hours`, `5s`) and ISO 8601 duration (e.g., `PT24H`).

timestampField.description: An optional reference to the field that contains the timestamp that the threshold refers to.

frequency.description: Frequency describes how often data is updated.

description.description: An optional string describing the frequency service level.
description.example: Data is delivered once a day.

type.description: The method of data processing.

interval.description: Optional. Only for batch: How often the pipeline is triggered, e.g., `daily`.

cron.description: Optional. Only for batch: A cron expression when the pipelines is triggered. E.g., `0 0 * * *`.

support.description: Support describes the times when support will be available for contact.

description.description: An optional string describing the support service level.
description.example: The data is available during typical business hours at headquarters.

time.description: An optional string describing the times when support will be available for contact such as `24/7` or `business hours only`.
time.example: 9am to 5pm in EST on business days

responseTime.description: An optional string describing the time it takes for the support team to acknowledge a request. This does not mean the issue will be resolved immediately, but it assures users that their request has been received and will be dealt with.

backup.description: Backup specifies details about data backup procedures.

description.description: An optional string describing the backup service level.
description.example: Data is backed up once a week, every Sunday at 0:00 UTC.

interval.description: An optional interval that defines how often data will be backed up, e.g., `daily`.

cron.description: An optional cron expression when data will be backed up, e.g., `0 0 * * *`.

recoveryTime.description: An optional Recovery Time Objective (RTO) specifies the maximum amount of time allowed to restore data from a backup after a failure or loss event (e.g., 4 hours, 24 hours).

recoveryPoint.description: An optional Recovery Point Objective (RPO) defines the maximum acceptable age of files that must be recovered from backup storage for normal operations to resume after a disaster or data loss event. This essentially measures how much data you can afford to lose, measured in time (e.g., 4 hours, 24 hours).

type.title: QualityType
type.description: The type of the quality check. Typical values are SodaCL, montecarlo, great-expectations, custom.

oneOf.description: The specification of the quality attributes as a string.
The specification of the quality attributes as an object.

quality.description: The quality object contains quality attributes and checks.

additionalProperties.title: Link
additionalProperties.description: A URL to an external resource.

items.description: Tags to facilitate searching and filtering.

tags.description: Tags to facilitate searching and filtering.

FieldType.title: FieldType
FieldType.description: The logical data type of the field.
